task.summary: [#2] Enhancing functionality of edit page to include a heading line and first 40 characters of the text etc. Not finished yet.
[#4] More work on Edit Index page. A bit of formatting and inclusion of the first 40 characters of the page contents field.
[#11] Changes to implement enabled flag in view and edit pages.
[#11 state:resolved][#4 state:resolved] Complete initial implementation of edit page and add page.

[#5 state:resolved][#6 state:resolved][#8 state:resolved][#9 state:resolved] - Implemented code to generate linkbars for pages of given Category (Mistress or Chambers) - Replaced current hard coded header include files with dynamically generate linkbars - Implemented the name of the home page as a servlet context init parameter. - Created method to calculate a link to the home page

[#8] Added code to read flag for a screen to check whether it is a gallery page. If so the appropriate folder is parsed and any images have a thumbnail created unless the thumbnail already exists. A thumbnail table is added to the end of the page.
This is a first pass. The flag isn't reflected in the edit and update pages yet. Quite a lot of code written to create the thumbnails and manipulate the files in the folder and create the html to represent the thumbnail table.
Started a bit of general re-factoring and cleaning up. Still quite a lot to do.
[#10] Got automatic thumbnails working and gallery display. Still need to update screen edit page to allow gallery configuration flag to be set.
[#10] Updated so gallery flag appears and can be edited (editIndex, add and edit)

[#16] More work on refactoring. Am replacing the long if then else sequence in doGet and doPost with instantiations of subclasses of ActionClass. This will simplify the logic and create a more homogeneous approach to dealing with different types of request. Not sure it is right but I am sure I am moving in the right direction.
Need to think how I will deal with the fact that some requests result in a redirection - where should this logic be implemented?

[#16] Have completed this round of re-factoring. All the methods to process the request strings have been replaced by instantiations of an object (subclass of ActionClass). A couple of notes:
- The setting of the redirect flag is still hard coded within the if then else loop in doGet / doPost in ControllerHelper. I need to delegate this to the ActionClass subClasses.
- Because I moved the code out of the ControllerHelper the way the data object was populated within the UpdateScreenAction class didn't work because data was passed in. In fixing this I discovered the BeanUtils class and the populate method. This has opened a whole new world and has helped to increase my understanding of the way Java Beans work. I also believe the code is more cohesive and modular now so I am happy this is going in the right direction although there is a long way to go.

[#24 state:resolved] Modified editIndex.jsp to remove option to delete a page. This is in anticipation of going live and ensuring that pages aren't deleted by mistake. Can us enabled flag to stop pages being displayed and where necessary pages can be deleted through direct database manipulation.

[#19 state:resolved] As it turned out this was a different error from what I thought. The creation of galleries wasn't in the code, there was just a single creation of the chambers gallery which I had put in for test purposes. I fixed by changing the logic so that when trying to get a gallery for the first time it is created then. This seems to work but will do more rigorous testing as part of full testing ticket.

This is a big commit as I haven't been committing as I go which I should have. A number of tickets under the User Acceptance Testing Milestone are fixed here. The code isn't working as I am still in the process of fixing the duplicate screen name issue.
[#32] Lots of changes relating to this ticket. See previous notes for details on changes.

[#36] Fairly basic solution - just added a sort index column manually updated and sort editIndex and linkbars with it. Was a relatively easy change - the hardest bit was remembering how to add a column to a database and then re-generated the JavaBean / hibernated code to encapsulate it.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE

[#8] Added code to read flag for a screen to check whether it is a gallery page. If so the appropriate folder is parsed and any images have a thumbnail created unless the thumbnail already exists. A thumbnail table is added to the end of the page.
This is a first pass. The flag isn't reflected in the edit and update pages yet. Quite a lot of code written to create the thumbnails and manipulate the files in the folder and create the html to represent the thumbnail table.

[#16] More work on refactoring. Am replacing the long if then else sequence in doGet and doPost with instantiations of subclasses of ActionClass. This will simplify the logic and create a more homogeneous approach to dealing with different types of request. Not sure it is right but I am sure I am moving in the right direction.

[#16] Have completed this round of re-factoring. All the methods to process the request strings have been replaced by instantiations of an object (subclass of ActionClass). A couple of notes:
- The setting of the redirect flag is still hard coded within the if then else loop in doGet / doPost in ControllerHelper. I need to delegate this to the ActionClass subClasses.
- Because I moved the code out of the ControllerHelper the way the data object was populated within the UpdateScreenAction class didn't work because data was passed in. In fixing this I discovered the BeanUtils class and the populate method. This has opened a whole new world and has helped to increase my understanding of the way Java Beans work. I also believe the code is more cohesive and modular now so I am happy this is going in the right direction although there is a long way to go.

[#19 state:resolved] As it turned out this was a different error from what I thought. The creation of galleries wasn't in the code, there was just a single creation of the chambers gallery which I had put in for test purposes. I fixed by changing the logic so that when trying to get a gallery for the first time it is created then. This seems to work but will do more rigorous testing as part of full testing ticket.

This is a big commit as I haven't been committing as I go which I should have. A number of tickets under the User Acceptance Testing Milestone are fixed here. The code isn't working as I am still in the process of fixing the duplicate screen name issue.
